Document.author: petere
Document.document: Separated set constraints and set transaction reference pages, revised set reference page to new configuration system. Big update to administrator's guide, chapters Runtime environment, Client authentication, and User management, the latter two were part of the old Security chapter.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Reimplement nodeMaterial to use a temporary BufFile (or even memory, if the materialized tupleset is small enough) instead of a temporary relation. This was something I was thinking of doing anyway for performance, and Jan says he needs it for TOAST because he doesn't want to cope with toasting noname relations. With this change, the 'noname table' support in heap.c is dead code, and I have accordingly removed it. Also clean up 'noname' plan handling in planner --- nonames are either sort or materialize plans, and it seems less confusing to handle them separately under those names.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Linux/alpha patch.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up bogosities in pg_opclass, pg_amop, pg_amproc. There are amproc entries now for int8 and network hash indexes. int24_ops and int42_ops are gone. pg_opclass no longer contains multiple entries claiming to be the default opclass for the same datatype. opr_sanity regress test extended to catch errors like these in the future.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: fix HAVE_SQLGETPRIVATEPROFILESTRING define

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Rename HAVE_SQLGETPRIVATEPROFILESTRING to something resonable in length and readability.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: autoconf

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update to /contrib from Karel.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add missing /contrib files

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove old README files.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Integrated ODBC driver into regular build. No more standalone business, which didn't work anyway. Had to back out unixodbc related patch which broke the regular ODBC build.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ensure that kernel error code is included in smgr-level error reports. Tweak mdcreate a little bit so that it returns the right errno.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Modify index-opening code to guarantee that the indexes of a relation are opened in a consistent order by different backends (I ordered them by index OID because that's easy, but any other consistent order would do as well). This avoids potential deadlock for index types that we acquire exclusive locks on ... ie, rtree.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix handling of type tuple associated with a temp relation. We have to apply the tempname->realname mapping to type name lookup as well as relation name lookup, else the type tuple will not be found when wanted. This fixes bugs like this one: create temp table foo (f1 int)SEMICOLON select foo.f2 from fooSEMICOLON ERROR: Unable to locate type name 'foo' in catalog

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make inheritance planning logic a little simpler and clearer, hopefully even a little faster.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make renaming a temp table behave sensibly. We don't need to touch the underlying table at all, just change the mapping entry ... but that logic was missing.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Cleaned up PL/pgSQL build. Fixed a couple of copyandpaste'os in the interfaces and interfaces/odbc make files. Adjusted regression test driver to start building and installing in the top level directory.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > Great! Please cc: the docs or hackers mailing lists to make sure the > patches are not lost... Aggregate doc patches: The patches are attached. Be great if you could check them over to make sure all relevant content (and markup) is there... Isaac Wilcox

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fix typo

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Second pass over run-time configuration system. Adjust priorities on some option settings. Sort out SIGHUP vs BACKEND -- there is no total ordering here, so make explicit checks. Add comments explaining all of this. Removed permissions check on SHOW command. Add examine_subclass to the game, rename to SQL_inheritance to fit the official data model better. Adjust documentation. Standalone backend needs to reset all options before it starts. To facilitate that, have IsUnderPostmaster be set by the postmaster itself, don't wait for the magic -p switch. Also make sure that all environment variables and argv's survive init_ps_display(). Use strdup where necessary. Have initdb make configuration files (postgresql.conf, pg_hba.conf) mode 0600 -- having configuration files is no fun if you can't edit them.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update FAQ.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update FAQ.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Relaxed pickiness about user and group commands in transaction blocks.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Added new commands and intelligence to psql tab completion.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix BACKSLASHpset null to use ', not ".

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Makefile cleanup for bin and pl subtrees. They should now support all the standard semantics. Also get rid of Makefile.in's on the way and instead declare all variables in Makefile.global.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Tamotsu Nakagawa has posted a fix for this to a local mail list in Japan. Can someone comment on this? According to him, with the patch now only the geometry test fails. Tatsuo Ishii

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: First phase of memory management rewrite (see backend/utils/mmgr/README for details). It doesn't really do that much yet, since there are no short-term memory contexts in the executor, but the infrastructure is in place and long-term contexts are handled reasonably. A few long- standing bugs have been fixed, such as 'VACUUMSEMICOLON anything' in a single query string crashing. Also, out-of-memory is now considered a recoverable ERROR, not FATAL. Eliminate a large amount of crufty, now-dead code in and around memory management. Fix problem with holding off SIGTRAP, SIGSEGV, etc in postmaster and backend startup.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Call me silly, but I think it would be a good idea if initdb and other scripts are executable after being installed. Latest changes got the permissions wrong (non executable).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair incorrect assumption that all versions of 'install' know how to install multiple files in one invocation.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Suppress memory leak in COPY WITH OIDS TO wherever.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch COPY WITH OIDS leak fix.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Makefile cleanup for interface tree. Now essentially with all the standard targets and behaviour. Replaced Makefile.in's with Makefile's and declared the respective variables in Makefile.global. maintainer-clean target now available at top level, although it does not work in the backend tree yet. Cleanup pass over Makefile.shlib, renamed some targets and variables. The shared library symlink tests are now done by make, not the shell. ecpg: Remove one warning in sloppy flex output. PL/Perl and Perl interface: the MakeMaker documentation is confusing, the realclean target *does* "delete derived files", but it also uninstalls them. Don't use that. The submake targets in the various bin directories that update libpq should `make all', not `make libpq.a'. That is a) unportable, and b) doesn't build the shared library.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add #ifdef for LC_MESSAGES, because it is not ANSI C standard, and BSDI does not have it.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add SIGFPE to list of signals never to block. #ifdef all signals in that list to cope with platforms that don't have them all.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove freefuncs.c, which hasn't been used in a long time and is not worth the effort to continue to maintain. Since freeObject() is not capable of coping with cases like multiple links to a node, it's unlikely that it ever will be useful again. We now have memory context management that offers a faster and more reliable way of getting rid of arbitrary node trees (at the cost of having to know in advance of building the tree that you'll want to get rid of it).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Rearrange config.h entries into a more sensible order, and add some documentation. Let's try to keep this file a bit neater in future, hmm? Also (to get back to the original point) update info about FUNC_MAX_ARGS, and add additional config symbols for debugging new memory management changes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add test code to copy all parse/plan trees. Repair essential omissions in copyfuncs and equalfuncs exposed by regression tests. We still have some work to do: these modules really ought to handle most or all of the utility statement node types. But it's better than it was.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix quotes in /* */ comments in psql.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Use a private memory context to store rule information in each relcache entry that has rules. This allows us to release the rule parsetrees on relcache flush without needing a working freeObject() routine. Formerly, the rule trees were leaked permanently at relcache flush. Also, clean up handling of rule creation and deletion --- there was not sufficient locking of the relation being modified, and there was no reliable notification of other backends that a relcache reload was needed. Also, clean up relcache.c code so that scans of system tables needed to load a relcache entry are done in the caller's memory context, not in CacheMemoryContext. This prevents any un-pfreed memory from those scans from becoming a permanent memory leak.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: RemoveView was doing things the hard way...

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fixes for Solaris/cc suggested by <pgsql-hackers@thewrittenword.com> Don't use DISABLE_COMPLEX_MACRO on Solaris. Don't define the replacement function in the header file. Use -KPIC, not -K PIC. Use CC to link C++ libraries, not ld/ar. Eliminate file not found warnings in tcl build code.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: New and revised material for Admin guide, re backup & restore and database management

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix select '1--2'SEMICOLON for PEter.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: In the attache is new to_date()/to_timestamp() version. Now the to_timestamp() support WW,W,J,SSSS,DDD conversion from strings and the am/pm bug is fixed, the to_char() use week-of-year (WW) full compatible with Oracle. This patch update relevant regress-tests and docs too. Karel ~ ~

Document.author: petere
Document.document: A little bit of clean-up/bug fix in Tcl build. Handle gracefully cases where someone wants to build these but hasn't configured for Tcl.

Document.document: We don't need config.status substituting anything into Gen_fmgrtab.sh, we just pass in CPP and AWK via the environment from the Makefile.

Document.document: Don't run in CacheMemoryContext more than necessary.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Version number now set in configure, available through Makefile.global and config.h. Adjusted all referring code. Scrapped pg_version and changed initdb accordingly. Integrated src/utils/version.c into src/backend/utils/init/miscinit.c. Changed all callers. Set version number to `7.1devel'. (Non-numeric version suffixes now allowed.)

Please remove these files: contrib/lo/test.sql contrib/pg_dumplo/Makefile.out contrib/pgbench/pgbench_jis.doc contrib/spi/new_example.example contrib/spi/README.MAX Thanks. Karel

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Have pg_dumpall write CREATE USER and CREATE GROUP commands instead of raw COPYs of pg_shadow and pg_group. It also turns out that pg_dumpall was all but broken for multiple servers running at non-standard port numbers. You might get the users and groups from one server and the databases from another. Fixed that. A little user interface and code cleanup along with that. This also takes care of the portability bug discussed in "[BUGS] pg_dumpall" in March 2000.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Move PGPORT envar handling to ResetAllOptions(). Improve long options parsing to not clobber the optarg string -- so that we can bring SetOptsFile() up to speed.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: attached to this mail is a patch from a colleague that makes PostgreSQL-7.0.2 run on Linux for the Intel-IA64 architecture. It also fixes a bug in the configure scripts that caused configure to fail on the fcntl(F_SETLK) test. This fix triggered a bug in the fcntl(F_SETLK) code of the Linux kernel when used on unix domain sockets resulting in postmaster to segfault immediately after startup. There is a fix available and included in the kernel that will be on SuSE Linux 7.0, but kernels <= 2.2.16 still have this bug. Reinhard Max

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: autoconf

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Changed TOAST relations to have relkind RELKIND_TOASTVALUE. Special handling of TOAST relations during VACUUM. TOAST relations are vacuumed while the lock on the master table is still active. The ANALYZE flag doesn't propagate to their vacuuming because the toaster access routines allways use index access ignoring stats, so why compute them at all. Protection of TOAST relations against normal INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE while offering SELECT for debugging purposes. Jan

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: add check for libz compression library for pg_dump

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Enable pg_rewrite to be toasted (unlimited size of views and rules). Jan

Document.document: Fix typo (extraneous semicolon) in fd.c patch to avoid excess seeks. Now it skips useless SEEK_CUR 0 calls too, as intended.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Backend makefile cleanup. make maintainer-clean is now completely functional. Handle include file installation in src/include/Makefile genbki.sh improvements: Don't substitute anything by config.status, instead pass in AWK and CPP through environment. Change calling convention to support named output files, so we get to see error messages on stderr. Rename bootstrap template files and install them into PREFIX/share. Update initdb to that effect and other readability improvements in initdb.

Document.document: Correct unsafe use of strcmp(). See rant of same date posted to pghackers.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move FAQ source into main cvs tree.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: |> The Makefile.shlib changes will have to be discussed with other Linux |> developers so we are sure it will work on all platforms. The problem with the current settings is that the linker is called directly. This is wrong, it should always be called through the compiler driver (the only exception is `ld -r'). This will make sure that the necessary libraries like libgcc are linked in. But there is still a different problem with the setting of LDFLAGS_ODBC. The psqlodbc module defines the functions _init and _fini which are reserved for the shared library initialisation. These should be changed to constructor functions. Then LDFLAGS_ODBC can be changed to be just `-lm'. Btw, why does it use -Bsymbolic? Andreas Schwab

Document.document: - format_type function, in use by psql - added bigint as synonym of int8 - set typelem of varlen non-array types to 0

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix misuse of StrNCpy to copy and add null to non-null-terminated data. Does not work since it fetches one byte beyond the source data, and when the phase of the moon is wrong, the source data is smack up against the end of backend memory and you get SIGSEGV. Don't laugh, this is a fix for an actual user bug report.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch StrNCpy fix.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove long-dead support for invoking queries from dynamically loaded backend functions via backend PQexec(). The SPI interface has long been our only documented way to do this, and the backend pqexec/portal code is unused and suffering bit-rot. I'm putting it out of its misery.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make view/rule permission checking behave properly with subqueries in the rule.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Another round of those unportable config/build changes :-/ * Add option to build with OpenSSL out of the box. Fix thusly exposed bit rot. Although it compiles now, getting this to do something useful is left as an exercise. * Fix Kerberos options to defer checking for required libraries until all the other libraries are checked for. * Change default odbcinst.ini and krb5.srvtab path to PREFIX/etc. * Install work around for Autoconf's install-sh relative path anomaly. Get rid of old INSTL_*_OPTS variables, now that we don't need them anymore. * Use `gunzip -c' instead of g?zcat. Reportedly broke on AIX. * Look for only one of readline.h or readline/readline.h, not both. * Make check for PS_STRINGS cacheable. Don't test for the header files separately. * Disable fcntl(F_SETLK) test on Linux. * Substitute the standard GCC warnings set into CFLAGS in configure, don't add it on in Makefile.global. * Sweep through contrib tree to teach makefiles standard semantics. ... and in completely unrelated news: * Make postmaster.opts arbitrary options-aware. I still think we need to save the environment as well.

Document.document: Done. In backend/commands/define.c unused field is set to '-' for the moment. A patch for CVS is attached, and I have amended my BLOB dumping version appropriately. Philip Warner

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Here is the patch with memory leak checker. This checker allow detect in-chunk leaks, overwrite-next-chunk leaks and overwrite block-freeptr leaks. A in-chunk leak --- if something overwrite space after wanted (via palloc() size, but it is still inside chunk. For example x = palloc(12)SEMICOLON /* create 16b chunk */ memset(x, '#', 13)SEMICOLON this leak is in the current source total invisible, because chunk is 16b and leak is in the "align space". For this feature I add data_size to StandardChunk, and all memory which go from AllocSetAlloc() is marked as 0x7F. The MemoryContextCheck() is compiled '#ifdef USE_ASSERT_CHECKING'. I add this checking to 'tcop/postgres.c' and is active after each backend query, but it is probably not sufficient, because some MemoryContext exist only during memory processing --- will good if someone who known where it is needful (Tom:-) add it for others contextsSEMICOLON A problem in the current source is that we have still some malloc() allocation that is not needful and this allocation is total invisible for all context routines. For example Dllist in backend (pretty dirty it is in catcache where values in Dllist are palloc-ed, but list is malloc-ed). --- and BTW. this Dllist design stand in the way for query cache :-) Tom, if you agree I start replace some mallocs. BTW. --- Tom, have you idea for across transaction presistent allocation for SQL functions? (like regex - now it is via malloc) I almost forget. I add one if() to AllocSetAlloc(), for 'size' that are greater than ALLOC_BIGCHUNK_LIMIT is not needful check AllocSetFreeIndex(), because 'fidx' is always 'ALLOCSET_NUM_FREELISTS - 1'. It a little brisk up allocation for very large chunks. Right? Karel

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: First stage of reclaiming memory in executor by resetting short-term memory contexts. Currently, only leaks in expressions executed as quals or projections are handled. Clean up some old dead cruft in executor while at it --- unused fields in state nodes, that sort of thing.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair missing MEMORY_CONTEXT_CHECKING logic for realloc(). Doesn't anyone around here run regression tests before submitting patches, or before committing them?

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Add assert checking to GUC ("debug_assertions") Rename settings net_server to tcpip_socket, max_backends to max_connections Add --help and --version to postmaster, reformat help output

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Can you please apply the following patch to current CVS to make AIX'ers happy with the changes to the version.o ? Together with the patch I sent Tom, AIX now regresses ok. Thanx Andreas

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Remove a bunch of unused configure tests, in particular cases where * the result is not recorded anywhere * the result is not used anywhere * the result is only used in some places, whereas others have been getting away with it * the result is used improperly Also make command line options handling a little better (e.g., --disable-locale, while redundant, should really still *dis*able).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Planner did the wrong thing with index-scan-backward plans: generated them, but forgot to attach relevant restriction clauses, so that the plan represented a scan over the whole table with restrictions applied as qpquals not indexquals. Another day, another bug...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Backpatch backwards-index-scan fix.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Repair parallel make in backend tree (and make it really parallel). Make Gen_fmgrtab.sh reasonably robust against concurrent invocation.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fix typo, from Keith Parks

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Update docs for TIME WITHOUT TIME ZONE. Add information on SET SESSION CHARACTERISTICS. Fix references to pg_hba.conf(5) since that is no longer a man page.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add information on SET SESSION CHARACTERISTICS. Fix references to pg_hba.conf(5) since that is no longer a man page. Make minor repairs to "Compatibility" subsections.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Save changes from last docs release.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Change order of builds to get parser before commands. This will ensure building parse.h for commands, though this is also covered with other build rules.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Include rule to build include/parser/parse.h since nothing else can build in this directory otherwise :(

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Fix indenting in prototype declarations. No functional changes.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Implement SET SESSION CHARACTERISTICS and SET DefaultXactIsoLevel.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Implement nested block comments in the backend and in psql. Include updates for the comment.sql regression test. Implement SET SESSION CHARACTERISTICS and SET DefaultXactIsoLevel. Implement SET SESSION CHARACTERISTICS TRANSACTION COMMIT and SET AutoCommit in the parser only. Need to add code to actually do something. Implement WITHOUT TIME ZONE type qualifier. Define SCHEMA keyword, along with stubbed-out grammar. Implement "[IN|INOUT|OUT] [varname] type" function arguments in parser onlySEMICOLON INOUT and OUT throws an elog(ERROR). Add PATH as a type-specific token, since PATH is in SQL99 to support schema resource search and resolution.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Fix munged markup from previous commit.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Remove references to symbols that no longer get defined

Document.author: petere
Document.document: didn't compile

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Remove dangling else warning (Cyrillic recode stuff)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cleanup of code for creating index entries. Functional indexes with pass-by-ref data types --- eg, an index on lower(textfield) --- no longer leak memory during index creation or update. Clean up a lot of redundant code ... did you know that copy, vacuum, truncate, reindex, extend index, and bootstrap each basically duplicated the main executor's logic for extracting information about an index and preparing index entries? Functional indexes should be a little faster now too, due to removal of repeated function lookups. CREATE INDEX 'opt_type' clause is deimplemented by these changes, but I haven't removed it from the parser yet (need to merge with Thomas' latest change set first).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove useless and dangerous 'opt_type' option from CREATE INDEX.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update implementation notes for new memory management logic.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: This should be a slighly more complete patch for commands/command.c AlterTableAddConstraint. The major changes from the last patch are that it should hopefully check for references to temp tables (not in the shadow case, but at defination time) from permanent tables in foreign keys and refuse them and that it doesn't allow the table(s) being constrained to be views (because those cases don't currently work). Stephan SzaboThis should be a slighly more complete patch for commands/command.c AlterTableAddConstraint. The major changes from the last patch are that it should hopefully check for references to temp tables (not in the shadow case, but at defination time) from permanent tables in foreign keys and refuse them and that it doesn't allow the table(s) being constrained to be views (because those cases don't currently work). Stephan Szabo

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Rename templates to match names in makefiles/Makefile.* and include/port. Read templates after compiler is detected. Convert all templates to real shell scripts. Rename bsd->openbsd, alpha->osf.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Revise locale and Kerberos documentation

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Incorporate README.fsync into main documentation body

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Automatic dependency tracking The .DEFAULT rule in backend/Makefile is harmful -- removed. Replace `::' rules by `:'.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Hmm. I didn't expect a change since I hadn't added tests for the new stuff, but fixing the bug that existed in reporting the constraint name changes the error line. Patch to expected output enclosed. Stephan Szabo

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: pltcl seems to be broken on HPUX with recent Tcl versions, because link needs to specify -lc but doesn't. Quick hack to make it better.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: update pltcl test to have at least some chance of running ... still seems to be busted though ...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revise aggregate functions per earlier discussions in pghackers. There's now only one transition value and transition function. NULL handling in aggregates is a lot cleaner. Also, use Numeric accumulators instead of integer accumulators for sum/avg on integer datatypes --- this avoids overflow at the cost of being a little slower. Implement VARIANCE() and STDDEV() aggregates in the standard backend. Also, enable new LIKE selectivity estimators by default. Unrelated change, but as long as I had to force initdb anyway...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update aggregate-function docs for STDDEV, VARIANCE.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Stat functions now in main system, contrib code no longer needed.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: I concur with Andreas: unconditionally including <sys/fcntl.h> is not portable. Seems to have been added for O_BINARY, which is only needed for __CYGWIN32__, so include it here only in that case.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update TODO list.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Don't strip trailing backslashes from a line. Treat them more reasonably.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: End users shouldn't have to invoke a separate command to install the documentation. Therefore it's now installed by default. If there is no documentation to be found (i.e., you are not using the distribution) then this step is skipped. Add --docdir option to configure to control installation directory.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Correct erroneous explanation of DEADLOCK_TIMEOUT configuration setting.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: forgot autoconf run...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: 'const' decorations are fine, but not when they're inserted without bothering to clean up the resulting warnings ...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update pltcl regress test's expected output for 7.0 psql output format. NOTE: this implementation of tcl_avg() fails with 'divide by zero' for zero input rows. It ought to return NULL, but pltcl does not currently provide a way to do that, so I'm leaving the problem unsolved for now.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add an opr_sanity check for misdefined aggregates that have transition type different from input type but are expecting ExecAgg to insert the first non-null input as the starting transition value. This has always been verboten, but wasn't checked for until now...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: 'const' decorations are fine, but not when they're inserted without bothering to clean up the resulting warnings ...

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Remove references to symbols that no longer get defined

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: |> The Makefile.shlib changes will have to be discussed with other Linux |> developers so we are sure it will work on all platforms. The problem with the current settings is that the linker is called directly. This is wrong, it should always be called through the compiler driver (the only exception is `ld -r'). This will make sure that the necessary libraries like libgcc are linked in. But there is still a different problem with the setting of LDFLAGS_ODBC. The psqlodbc module defines the functions _init and _fini which are reserved for the shared library initialisation. These should be changed to constructor functions. Then LDFLAGS_ODBC can be changed to be just `-lm'. Btw, why does it use -Bsymbolic? Andreas Schwab

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Added comments about the compression algorithm as requested by Tom Jan

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix typo (extraneous semicolon) in fd.c patch to avoid excess seeks. Now it skips useless SEEK_CUR 0 calls too, as intended.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: attached to this mail is a patch from a colleague that makes PostgreSQL-7.0.2 run on Linux for the Intel-IA64 architecture. It also fixes a bug in the configure scripts that caused configure to fail on the fcntl(F_SETLK) test. This fix triggered a bug in the fcntl(F_SETLK) code of the Linux kernel when used on unix domain sockets resulting in postmaster to segfault immediately after startup. There is a fix available and included in the kernel that will be on SuSE Linux 7.0, but kernels <= 2.2.16 still have this bug. Reinhard Max

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Moving toaster out of NO ELOG area in heap_update(). Jan

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: fix HAVE_SQLGETPRIVATEPROFILESTRING define

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Separated set constraints and set transaction reference pages, revised set reference page to new configuration system. Big update to administrator's guide, chapters Runtime environment, Client authentication, and User management, the latter two were part of the old Security chapter.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Automatic dependency tracking The .DEFAULT rule in backend/Makefile is harmful -- removed. Replace `::' rules by `:'.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Very small changes in the contrib's pg_dumplo in the attache. And: Note, Bruce I found in the contrib tree any files that we forget remove during contrib cleaning. Please remove these files: contrib/lo/test.sql contrib/pg_dumplo/Makefile.out contrib/pgbench/pgbench_jis.doc contrib/spi/new_example.example contrib/spi/README.MAX Thanks. Karel

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: In the attache is new (correct) version. I add TZ (timezone) support for to_char() too. Karel

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Attached is a new patch which addresses this problem. (oids in regression tests). Chris Bitmead

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Reimplement nodeMaterial to use a temporary BufFile (or even memory, if the materialized tupleset is small enough) instead of a temporary relation. This was something I was thinking of doing anyway for performance, and Jan says he needs it for TOAST because he doesn't want to cope with toasting noname relations. With this change, the 'noname table' support in heap.c is dead code, and I have accordingly removed it. Also clean up 'noname' plan handling in planner --- nonames are either sort or materialize plans, and it seems less confusing to handle them separately under those names.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Revise aggregate functions per earlier discussions in pghackers. There's now only one transition value and transition function. NULL handling in aggregates is a lot cleaner. Also, use Numeric accumulators instead of integer accumulators for sum/avg on integer datatypes --- this avoids overflow at the cost of being a little slower. Implement VARIANCE() and STDDEV() aggregates in the standard backend. Also, enable new LIKE selectivity estimators by default. Unrelated change, but as long as I had to force initdb anyway...

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: TOAST changes to catalog Jan

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Have pg_dumpall write CREATE USER and CREATE GROUP commands instead of raw COPYs of pg_shadow and pg_group. It also turns out that pg_dumpall was all but broken for multiple servers running at non-standard port numbers. You might get the users and groups from one server and the databases from another. Fixed that. A little user interface and code cleanup along with that. This also takes care of the portability bug discussed in "[BUGS] pg_dumpall" in March 2000.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Linux/alpha patch.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Fix indenting in prototype declarations. No functional changes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair missing MEMORY_CONTEXT_CHECKING logic for realloc(). Doesn't anyone around here run regression tests before submitting patches, or before committing them?

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Done. In backend/commands/define.c unused field is set to '-' for the moment. A patch for CVS is attached, and I have amended my BLOB dumping version appropriately. Philip Warner

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Prevent creating a boatload of empty segments when md.c is asked to access a ridiculously large block number within a relation.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove HTML FAQ files that are really just text files.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: New resultmap for Alpha, from Ryan Kirkpatrick

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Make pgdump_oid a temp table. Rename to pg_dump_oid.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix quotes in /* */ comments in psql.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Makefile cleanup for bin and pl subtrees. They should now support all the standard semantics. Also get rid of Makefile.in's on the way and instead declare all variables in Makefile.global.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix handling of type tuple associated with a temp relation. We have to apply the tempname->realname mapping to type name lookup as well as relation name lookup, else the type tuple will not be found when wanted. This fixes bugs like this one: create temp table foo (f1 int)SEMICOLON select foo.f2 from fooSEMICOLON ERROR: Unable to locate type name 'foo' in catalog

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Clean up bogosities in pg_opclass, pg_amop, pg_amproc. There are amproc entries now for int8 and network hash indexes. int24_ops and int42_ops are gone. pg_opclass no longer contains multiple entries claiming to be the default opclass for the same datatype. opr_sanity regress test extended to catch errors like these in the future.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: I concur with Andreas: unconditionally including <sys/fcntl.h> is not portable. Seems to have been added for O_BINARY, which is only needed for __CYGWIN32__, so include it here only in that case.

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Changed TOAST relations to have relkind RELKIND_TOASTVALUE. Special handling of TOAST relations during VACUUM. TOAST relations are vacuumed while the lock on the master table is still active. The ANALYZE flag doesn't propagate to their vacuuming because the toaster access routines allways use index access ignoring stats, so why compute them at all. Protection of TOAST relations against normal INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE while offering SELECT for debugging purposes. Jan

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: U Re-add flock TODO.detail.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fix broken pg_dump makefile

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Makefile cleanup from Karel.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix select '1--2'SEMICOLON for PEter.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update FAQ.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update FAQ.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Ensure that kernel error code is included in smgr-level error reports. Tweak mdcreate a little bit so that it returns the right errno.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Integrated ODBC driver into regular build. No more standalone business, which didn't work anyway. Had to back out unixodbc related patch which broke the regular ODBC build.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Rename HAVE_SQLGETPRIVATEPROFILESTRING to something resonable in length and readability.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update implementation notes for new memory management logic.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: autoconf

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: pg_dump patch from Philip Warner

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Version number now set in configure, available through Makefile.global and config.h. Adjusted all referring code. Scrapped pg_version and changed initdb accordingly. Integrated src/utils/version.c into src/backend/utils/init/miscinit.c. Changed all callers. Set version number to `7.1devel'. (Non-numeric version suffixes now allowed.)

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fixes for Solaris/cc suggested by <pgsql-hackers@thewrittenword.com> Don't use DISABLE_COMPLEX_MACRO on Solaris. Don't define the replacement function in the header file. Use -KPIC, not -K PIC. Use CC to link C++ libraries, not ld/ar. Eliminate file not found warnings in tcl build code.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch COPY WITH OIDS leak fix.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Suppress memory leak in COPY WITH OIDS TO wherever.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Cleaned up PL/pgSQL build. Fixed a couple of copyandpaste'os in the interfaces and interfaces/odbc make files. Adjusted regression test driver to start building and installing in the top level directory.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: autoconf

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update pltcl regress test's expected output for 7.0 psql output format. NOTE: this implementation of tcl_avg() fails with 'divide by zero' for zero input rows. It ought to return NULL, but pltcl does not currently provide a way to do that, so I'm leaving the problem unsolved for now.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Rename templates to match names in makefiles/Makefile.* and include/port. Read templates after compiler is detected. Convert all templates to real shell scripts. Rename bsd->openbsd, alpha->osf.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Remove a bunch of unused configure tests, in particular cases where * the result is not recorded anywhere * the result is not used anywhere * the result is only used in some places, whereas others have been getting away with it * the result is used improperly Also make command line options handling a little better (e.g., --disable-locale, while redundant, should really still *dis*able).

Document.author: petere
Document.document: - format_type function, in use by psql - added bigint as synonym of int8 - set typelem of varlen non-array types to 0

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Please find attached a patch for the pg_dump directory which addresses: - The problems Jan reported - incompatibility with configure (now uses HAVE_LIBZ instead of HAVE_ZLIB) - a problem in auto-detecting archive file format on piped archives Philip Warner

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Bugfix. If toasted tuple containted NULLs, DataFill() was handed a wrong pointer causing the bitmap overwriting the tuple header. Jan

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add test code to copy all parse/plan trees. Repair essential omissions in copyfuncs and equalfuncs exposed by regression tests. We still have some work to do: these modules really ought to handle most or all of the utility statement node types. But it's better than it was.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update to /contrib from Karel.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Repair parallel make in backend tree (and make it really parallel). Make Gen_fmgrtab.sh reasonably robust against concurrent invocation.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove long-dead support for invoking queries from dynamically loaded backend functions via backend PQexec(). The SPI interface has long been our only documented way to do this, and the backend pqexec/portal code is unused and suffering bit-rot. I'm putting it out of its misery.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Back-patch StrNCpy fix.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Move FAQ source into main cvs tree.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Expand secondary password file feature, so that you can use these files to restrict the set of users that can connect to a database but can still use the pg_shadow password. (You just leave off the password field in the secondary file.)

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add SIGFPE to list of signals never to block. #ifdef all signals in that list to cope with platforms that don't have them all.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Second pass over run-time configuration system. Adjust priorities on some option settings. Sort out SIGHUP vs BACKEND -- there is no total ordering here, so make explicit checks. Add comments explaining all of this. Removed permissions check on SHOW command. Add examine_subclass to the game, rename to SQL_inheritance to fit the official data model better. Adjust documentation. Standalone backend needs to reset all options before it starts. To facilitate that, have IsUnderPostmaster be set by the postmaster itself, don't wait for the magic -p switch. Also make sure that all environment variables and argv's survive init_ps_display(). Use strdup where necessary. Have initdb make configuration files (postgresql.conf, pg_hba.conf) mode 0600 -- having configuration files is no fun if you can't edit them.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add missing /contrib files

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add an opr_sanity check for misdefined aggregates that have transition type different from input type but are expecting ExecAgg to insert the first non-null input as the starting transition value. This has always been verboten, but wasn't checked for until now...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update aggregate-function docs for STDDEV, VARIANCE.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: update pltcl test to have at least some chance of running ... still seems to be busted though ...

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Remove dangling else warning (Cyrillic recode stuff)

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Fix munged markup from previous commit.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fix handling of pre-existing LD_LIBRARY_PATH, from Keith Parks

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Functions on 'text' type updated to new fmgr style. 'text' is now TOAST-able.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make inheritance planning logic a little simpler and clearer, hopefully even a little faster.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove old README files.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix misuse of StrNCpy to copy and add null to non-null-terminated data. Does not work since it fetches one byte beyond the source data, and when the phase of the moon is wrong, the source data is smack up against the end of backend memory and you get SIGSEGV. Don't laugh, this is a fix for an actual user bug report.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Correct unsafe use of strcmp(). See rant of same date posted to pghackers.

Document.author: scrappy
Document.document: add check for libz compression library for pg_dump

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Now that I look at it, is_stopword() is broken and always has been. Doesn't anyone remember how to program a binary search??

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: First phase of memory management rewrite (see backend/utils/mmgr/README for details). It doesn't really do that much yet, since there are no short-term memory contexts in the executor, but the infrastructure is in place and long-term contexts are handled reasonably. A few long- standing bugs have been fixed, such as 'VACUUMSEMICOLON anything' in a single query string crashing. Also, out-of-memory is now considered a recoverable ERROR, not FATAL. Eliminate a large amount of crufty, now-dead code in and around memory management. Fix problem with holding off SIGTRAP, SIGSEGV, etc in postmaster and backend startup.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make renaming a temp table behave sensibly. We don't need to touch the underlying table at all, just change the mapping entry ... but that logic was missing.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Modify index-opening code to guarantee that the indexes of a relation are opened in a consistent order by different backends (I ordered them by index OID because that's easy, but any other consistent order would do as well). This avoids potential deadlock for index types that we acquire exclusive locks on ... ie, rtree.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: First stage of reclaiming memory in executor by resetting short-term memory contexts. Currently, only leaks in expressions executed as quals or projections are handled. Clean up some old dead cruft in executor while at it --- unused fields in state nodes, that sort of thing.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: oidvectortypes: use SQL type names and separate by commas psql BACKSLASHdf: use format_type and oidvectortypes map type REAL to float4, not float8 psql BACKSLASHdd :work around UNION bug

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Update textin() and textout() to new fmgr style. This is just phase one of updating the whole text datatype, but there are so dang many calls of these two routines that it seems worth a separate commit.

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Enable pg_rewrite to be toasted (unlimited size of views and rules). Jan

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Move global internal files to PGDATA/global.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: heap' logging

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Add #ifdef for LC_MESSAGES, because it is not ANSI C standard, and BSDI does not have it.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: > Great! Please cc: the docs or hackers mailing lists to make sure the > patches are not lost... Aggregate doc patches: The patches are attached. Be great if you could check them over to make sure all relevant content (and markup) is there... Isaac Wilcox

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: pltcl seems to be broken on HPUX with recent Tcl versions, because link needs to specify -lc but doesn't. Quick hack to make it better.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Incorporate README.fsync into main documentation body

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Change order of builds to get parser before commands. This will ensure building parse.h for commands, though this is also covered with other build rules.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fix typo, from Keith Parks

Document.author: petere
Document.document: typo

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Remove reference to tag which is not available to the User's Guide when built on its own. UG now builds cleanly.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Rename cash_words_out to cash_words.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Result of strcmp() is a signed int. Per bug report from Paul McGarry.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Remove unused TODO.detail files.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update tablespaces TODO.detail item.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Added new commands and intelligence to psql tab completion.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Relaxed pickiness about user and group commands in transaction blocks.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fix typo

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Add information on SET SESSION CHARACTERISTICS. Fix references to pg_hba.conf(5) since that is no longer a man page. Make minor repairs to "Compatibility" subsections.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Update docs for TIME WITHOUT TIME ZONE. Add information on SET SESSION CHARACTERISTICS. Fix references to pg_hba.conf(5) since that is no longer a man page.

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Some security checks that we've found an external value completely when fetching toasted values. Jan

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Another round of those unportable config/build changes :-/ * Add option to build with OpenSSL out of the box. Fix thusly exposed bit rot. Although it compiles now, getting this to do something useful is left as an exercise. * Fix Kerberos options to defer checking for required libraries until all the other libraries are checked for. * Change default odbcinst.ini and krb5.srvtab path to PREFIX/etc. * Install work around for Autoconf's install-sh relative path anomaly. Get rid of old INSTL_*_OPTS variables, now that we don't need them anymore. * Use `gunzip -c' instead of g?zcat. Reportedly broke on AIX. * Look for only one of readline.h or readline/readline.h, not both. * Make check for PS_STRINGS cacheable. Don't test for the header files separately. * Disable fcntl(F_SETLK) test on Linux. * Substitute the standard GCC warnings set into CFLAGS in configure, don't add it on in Makefile.global. * Sweep through contrib tree to teach makefiles standard semantics. ... and in completely unrelated news: * Make postmaster.opts arbitrary options-aware. I still think we need to save the environment as well.

Document.author: inoue
Document.document: Add a check of HEAP_MARKED_FOR_UPDATE in HeapTupleSatisfiesDirty(). This enables unique constraint check in case of SELECT FOR UPDATEd.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Don't run in CacheMemoryContext more than necessary.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Don't run in CacheMemoryContext longer than necessary.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: New memmgr logic in xact.c failed if AbortTransaction() is called when there is no open transaction.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Back out Karels to_char changes.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: New and revised material for Admin guide, re backup & restore and database management

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Fix BACKSLASHpset null to use ', not ".

Document.author: petere
Document.document: forgot autoconf run...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Hmm. I didn't expect a change since I hadn't added tests for the new stuff, but fixing the bug that existed in reporting the constraint name changes the error line. Patch to expected output enclosed. Stephan Szabo

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Revise locale and Kerberos documentation

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make the regression tests safe for TOAST.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: DataFill() has no business resetting xact status bits in the infomask of the provided tuple.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove memory leak from VACUUM parsing.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Call me silly, but I think it would be a good idea if initdb and other scripts are executable after being installed. Latest changes got the permissions wrong (non executable).

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Tamotsu Nakagawa has posted a fix for this to a local mail list in Japan. Can someone comment on this? According to him, with the patch now only the geometry test fails. Tatsuo Ishii

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Correct erroneous explanation of DEADLOCK_TIMEOUT configuration setting.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Implement nested block comments in the backend and in psql. Include updates for the comment.sql regression test. Implement SET SESSION CHARACTERISTICS and SET DefaultXactIsoLevel. Implement SET SESSION CHARACTERISTICS TRANSACTION COMMIT and SET AutoCommit in the parser only. Need to add code to actually do something. Implement WITHOUT TIME ZONE type qualifier. Define SCHEMA keyword, along with stubbed-out grammar. Implement "[IN|INOUT|OUT] [varname] type" function arguments in parser onlySEMICOLON INOUT and OUT throws an elog(ERROR). Add PATH as a type-specific token, since PATH is in SQL99 to support schema resource search and resolution.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Implement SET SESSION CHARACTERISTICS and SET DefaultXactIsoLevel.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Here is the patch with memory leak checker. This checker allow detect in-chunk leaks, overwrite-next-chunk leaks and overwrite block-freeptr leaks. A in-chunk leak --- if something overwrite space after wanted (via palloc() size, but it is still inside chunk. For example x = palloc(12)SEMICOLON /* create 16b chunk */ memset(x, '#', 13)SEMICOLON this leak is in the current source total invisible, because chunk is 16b and leak is in the "align space". For this feature I add data_size to StandardChunk, and all memory which go from AllocSetAlloc() is marked as 0x7F. The MemoryContextCheck() is compiled '#ifdef USE_ASSERT_CHECKING'. I add this checking to 'tcop/postgres.c' and is active after each backend query, but it is probably not sufficient, because some MemoryContext exist only during memory processing --- will good if someone who known where it is needful (Tom:-) add it for others contextsSEMICOLON A problem in the current source is that we have still some malloc() allocation that is not needful and this allocation is total invisible for all context routines. For example Dllist in backend (pretty dirty it is in catcache where values in Dllist are palloc-ed, but list is malloc-ed). --- and BTW. this Dllist design stand in the way for query cache :-) Tom, if you agree I start replace some mallocs. BTW. --- Tom, have you idea for across transaction presistent allocation for SQL functions? (like regex - now it is via malloc) I almost forget. I add one if() to AllocSetAlloc(), for 'size' that are greater than ALLOC_BIGCHUNK_LIMIT is not needful check AllocSetFreeIndex(), because 'fidx' is always 'ALLOCSET_NUM_FREELISTS - 1'. It a little brisk up allocation for very large chunks. Right? Karel

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Seems we need <errno.h> to be included explicitly now...

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fix thinko in my last pg_dumpall change

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove unused variable. (Hey Peter, you use gcc, why didn't you notice this warning?)

Document.author: petere
Document.document: We don't need config.status substituting anything into Gen_fmgrtab.sh, we just pass in CPP and AWK via the environment from the Makefile.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: In the attache is new to_date()/to_timestamp() version. Now the to_timestamp() support WW,W,J,SSSS,DDD conversion from strings and the am/pm bug is fixed, the to_char() use week-of-year (WW) full compatible with Oracle. This patch update relevant regress-tests and docs too. Karel ~ ~

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Repair incorrect assumption that all versions of 'install' know how to install multiple files in one invocation.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Stat functions now in main system, contrib code no longer needed.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Add assert checking to GUC ("debug_assertions") Rename settings net_server to tcpip_socket, max_backends to max_connections Add --help and --version to postmaster, reformat help output

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Put back separate install-bin target ... I was using that, thank you ...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make toast-table creation and deletion work somewhat reliably. Don't go through pg_exec_query_dest(), but directly to the execution routines. Also, extend parameter lists so that there's no need to change the global setting of allowSystemTableMods, a hack that was certain to cause trouble in the event of any error.

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: misc

Document.author: vadim
Document.document: unlock buffer before releasing in heap_insert +unlock buffer in heap_fetch under !ItemIdIsUsed().

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: TOAST WARNING: This is actually broken - we have self-deadlocks due to concurrent changes in buffer management. Vadim and me are working on it. Jan

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Makefile cleanup for interface tree. Now essentially with all the standard targets and behaviour. Replaced Makefile.in's with Makefile's and declared the respective variables in Makefile.global. maintainer-clean target now available at top level, although it does not work in the backend tree yet. Cleanup pass over Makefile.shlib, renamed some targets and variables. The shared library symlink tests are now done by make, not the shell. ecpg: Remove one warning in sloppy flex output. PL/Perl and Perl interface: the MakeMaker documentation is confusing, the realclean target *does* "delete derived files", but it also uninstalls them. Don't use that. The submake targets in the various bin directories that update libpq should `make all', not `make libpq.a'. That is a) unportable, and b) doesn't build the shared library.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Update TODO list.

Document.author: thomas
Document.document: Save changes from last docs release.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Planner did the wrong thing with index-scan-backward plans: generated them, but forgot to attach relevant restriction clauses, so that the plan represented a scan over the whole table with restrictions applied as qpquals not indexquals. Another day, another bug...

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Add missing #include for TOAST.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: A little bit of clean-up/bug fix in Tcl build. Handle gracefully cases where someone wants to build these but hasn't configured for Tcl.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Rearrange config.h entries into a more sensible order, and add some documentation. Let's try to keep this file a bit neater in future, hmm? Also (to get back to the original point) update info about FUNC_MAX_ARGS, and add additional config symbols for debugging new memory management changes.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove freefuncs.c, which hasn't been used in a long time and is not worth the effort to continue to maintain. Since freeObject() is not capable of coping with cases like multiple links to a node, it's unlikely that it ever will be useful again. We now have memory context management that offers a faster and more reliable way of getting rid of arbitrary node trees (at the cost of having to know in advance of building the tree that you'll want to get rid of it).

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Don't strip trailing backslashes from a line. Treat them more reasonably.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Make view/rule permission checking behave properly with subqueries in the rule.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Fix bogus DatumGetInt32 coercion.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Use a private memory context to store rule information in each relcache entry that has rules. This allows us to release the rule parsetrees on relcache flush without needing a working freeObject() routine. Formerly, the rule trees were leaked permanently at relcache flush. Also, clean up handling of rule creation and deletion --- there was not sufficient locking of the relation being modified, and there was no reliable notification of other backends that a relcache reload was needed. Also, clean up relcache.c code so that scans of system tables needed to load a relcache entry are done in the caller's memory context, not in CacheMemoryContext. This prevents any un-pfreed memory from those scans from becoming a permanent memory leak.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: End users shouldn't have to invoke a separate command to install the documentation. Therefore it's now installed by default. If there is no documentation to be found (i.e., you are not using the distribution) then this step is skipped. Add --docdir option to configure to control installation directory.

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: This should be a slighly more complete patch for commands/command.c AlterTableAddConstraint. The major changes from the last patch are that it should hopefully check for references to temp tables (not in the shadow case, but at defination time) from permanent tables in foreign keys and refuse them and that it doesn't allow the table(s) being constrained to be views (because those cases don't currently work). Stephan SzaboThis should be a slighly more complete patch for commands/command.c AlterTableAddConstraint. The major changes from the last patch are that it should hopefully check for references to temp tables (not in the shadow case, but at defination time) from permanent tables in foreign keys and refuse them and that it doesn't allow the table(s) being constrained to be views (because those cases don't currently work). Stephan Szabo

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Remove useless and dangerous 'opt_type' option from CREATE INDEX.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Cleanup of code for creating index entries. Functional indexes with pass-by-ref data types --- eg, an index on lower(textfield) --- no longer leak memory during index creation or update. Clean up a lot of redundant code ... did you know that copy, vacuum, truncate, reindex, extend index, and bootstrap each basically duplicated the main executor's logic for extracting information about an index and preparing index entries? Functional indexes should be a little faster now too, due to removal of repeated function lookups. CREATE INDEX 'opt_type' clause is deimplemented by these changes, but I haven't removed it from the parser yet (need to merge with Thomas' latest change set first).

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: Backpatch backwards-index-scan fix.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: tuptoaster.h should surely not #include postgres.h.

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Synchronized integrated documentation with latest admin guide change.

Document.author: tgl
Document.document: RemoveView was doing things the hard way...

Document.author: momjian
Document.document: Can you please apply the following patch to current CVS to make AIX'ers happy with the changes to the version.o ? Together with the patch I sent Tom, AIX now regresses ok. Thanx Andreas

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Fix sed invocation, from Keith Parks

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Backend makefile cleanup. make maintainer-clean is now completely functional. Handle include file installation in src/include/Makefile genbki.sh improvements: Don't substitute anything by config.status, instead pass in AWK and CPP through environment. Change calling convention to support named output files, so we get to see error messages on stderr. Rename bootstrap template files and install them into PREFIX/share. Update initdb to that effect and other readability improvements in initdb.

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Small fix for ALTER TABLE xxx* ADD COLUMN ... Inherited child tables must not be open during creation of TOAST table Jan

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Automatically create toast tables on ALTER TABLE ... ADD COLUMN and SELECT ... INTO ... too. Jan

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Bugfix in ALTER TABLE CREATE TOAST TABLE Automatically create toast table at CREATE TABLE if new table has toastable attributes. Jan

Document.author: wieck
Document.document: Fixed lztextlen() bug in MULTIBYTE, still thinking that lztext does compression itself the old way. Jan

Document.document: Added CVS header Jan

Document.document: New contrib module for statistical mathematics Jan

Document.author: petere
Document.document: Move PGPORT envar handling to ResetAllOptions(). Improve long options parsing to not clobber the optarg string -- so that we can bring SetOptsFile() up to speed.

Document.document: Clean up memory-context stuff, other minor infelicities.
